explanation: Agent A is correct. The code calls strlen(username) and strlen(realm) with no runtime validation that the pointers are non-NULL or that the referenced objects are NUL-terminated. strlen is one of the <string.h> functions referred to by MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17; if either pointer is NULL or points to a non-NUL-terminated buffer, strlen will read beyond the object bounds (undefined behavior) and thus violate the rule. The only protections present are mhd_assert checks inside calc_userhash, but assertions are typically omitted in production builds and therefore do not provide the required runtime guarantee. Unless the API has an externally enforced and verifiable precondition that these arguments are non-NULL and point to NUL-terminated strings (and that this is proven by static analysis or otherwise), the call as written is non‑conforming to Rule 21.17.
